The region's many wineries are joined by various local businesses, civic groups, churches and individuals who work together to stage a great weeklong programme of events, which begins on Easter Saturday. Highlights of this popular celebration include a parade, a vintage car rally, craft and trade stalls and numerous food and drink vendors. Events and attractions are hosted at various venues and destinations around Barossa and thousands of visitors come to enjoy a drop of vintage wine, watch the entertainment, and relax with friends and family over a picnic.
General.VenueName: Various locations across the Barossa Valley.

General.Teaser: If there was ever a reason behind Adelaide gaining the tagline of Australia’s premier festival city, Adelaide Festival would be it. This internationally renowned, three-week extravaganza of arts includes everything from theatre, music and dance to film, visual art and literary events. Bold and inspiring, the festival isn’t just an all-inclusive cultural affair – good vibes reverberate around the city when it’s on.
General.Body: If there was ever a reason behind Adelaide gaining the tagline of Australia’s premier festival city, Adelaide Festival would be it. This internationally renowned, three-week extravaganza of arts includes everything from theatre, music and dance to film, visual art and literary events. Bold and inspiring, the festival isn’t just an all-inclusive cultural affair – good vibes reverberate around the city when it’s on.

General.Teaser: Australia’s largest arts event takes over the entire city of Adelaide for close to a month each year, when around 800 events take place in a wide assortment of different venues. Cabaret, dance, comedy, music, theatre, film, puppetry and visual arts all feature in the schedule.
General.Body: Australia’s largest arts event takes over the entire city of Adelaide for close to a month each year, when around 800 events take place in a wide assortment of different venues. Cabaret, dance, comedy, music, theatre, film, puppetry and visual arts all feature in the schedule.

General.EventCost: Spectating is free, but entry into the public tour varies depending on the route selected.
General.Teaser: Attracting some of the world’s best cyclists, the Tour Down Under is a chance for riders to race in and around Adelaide. The tour takes place across seven days, and is relatively flat, meaning fans stick around to see the exciting sprint finishes, which regularly occur en masse. Keen bike lovers can also take part themselves, with four routes to complete during the week.
General.Body: Attracting some of the world’s best cyclists, the Tour Down Under is a chance for riders to race in and around Adelaide. The tour takes place across seven days, and is relatively flat, meaning fans stick around to see the exciting sprint finishes, which regularly occur en masse. Keen bike lovers can also take part themselves, with four routes to complete during the week.

General.EventCost: Prices vary depending on ticket type bought, starting at AUD$45.
General.Teaser: One of the rounds of the AVESCO V8 Supercar Championship Series, the Clipsal 500 Adelaide is a hugely popular event in Australia that attracts crowds in excess of 250,000. It's an exciting event that sees the Victoria Park Racecourse filled with the sights, sounds and smells of these powerful cars. Visitors can also enjoy a number of other events such as the Clipsal 500 Adelaide Harley Parade, special dinners, autograph sessions and helicopter rides.
General.Body: One of the rounds of the AVESCO V8 Supercar Championship Series, the Clipsal 500 Adelaide is a hugely popular event in Australia that attracts crowds in excess of 250,000. It's an exciting event that sees the Victoria Park Racecourse filled with the sights, sounds and smells of these powerful cars. Visitors can also enjoy a number of other events such as the Clipsal 500 Adelaide Harley Parade, special dinners, autograph sessions and helicopter rides.

General.Teaser: Held every year in Adelaide, this popular event provides a showcase for the world's top culinary talents. The event not only celebrates the very best of the nation's food, but also covers wine, beer, gastronomic discussion, hospitality, travel and lifestyle issues. First held in 1997, each fair has a particular theme, with past events billed around 'Hot and Happening’, 'Taste the Magic' and 'The Elements: earth, air, fire and water'.
General.Body: Held every year in Adelaide, this popular event provides a showcase for the world's top culinary talents. The event not only celebrates the very best of the nation's food, but also covers wine, beer, gastronomic discussion, hospitality, travel and lifestyle issues. First held in 1997, each fair has a particular theme, with past events billed around 'Hot and Happening’, 'Taste the Magic' and 'The Elements: earth, air, fire and water'. The festival is an opportunity for the public to enjoy the best that South Australia and the nation at large has to offer in produce, food products, wines and beers, hospitality and tourism.

General.EventCost: $170 for weekend pass; day passes starting at $75.
General.Teaser: Voices of Sacred Earth Eco-Festival focuses on natural health, environmental awareness, spiritual development and social responsibility. It is a weekend of seminars, instructional workshops and performances which explore the many indigenous and cultural expressions and spiritualities that have evolved on our planet. The underlying philosophy that guides Kawai Purapura's development is one of harmonious living with the land, arising from an awareness of our oneness with all creation.
General.Body: Voices of Sacred Earth Eco-Festival focuses on natural health, environmental awareness, spiritual development and social responsibility. It is a weekend of seminars, instructional workshops and performances which explore the many indigenous and cultural expressions and spiritualities that have evolved on our planet. The underlying philosophy that guides Kawai Purapura's development is one of harmonious living with the land, arising from an awareness of our oneness with all creation.

Event.title: New Zealand International Jazz & Blues Festival

General.Teaser: One of the largest festivals in Australasia with international and local artists.
General.Body: One of the largest festivals in Australasia with international and local artists.

General.Teaser: The course of the full marathon and half marathon covers a wide swathe of the Bay, starting at Devonport on the north shore. There are also walking events over 10km (6.2 miles) and 5km (3.1 miles). This has been Auckland's premier road racing event since the 1980s, and it attracts 10,000 runners and large crowds of supporters. Besides the excitement and spectacle of the races themselves, which take place against the backdrop of the city and the Bay, there is a big free concert in Victoria Park near the finishing line.
General.Body: The course of the full marathon and half marathon covers a wide swathe of the Bay, starting at Devonport on the north shore. There are also walking events over 10km (6.2 miles) and 5km (3.1 miles). This has been Auckland's premier road racing event since the 1980s, and it attracts 10,000 runners and large crowds of supporters. Besides the excitement and spectacle of the races themselves, which take place against the backdrop of the city and the Bay, there is a big free concert in Victoria Park near the finishing line. Up to three recognised mainstream New Zealand bands play on stage in the evening, after a radio station party, various warm-up acts, kids' entertainments and a merchandise sales park have kept visitors entertained during the day.

Event.title: Auckland Anniversary Day Regatta & Harbour Festival

General.Teaser: Auckland celebrates its birthday with a grand regatta as it has since 1840. It is considered by some as the biggest one-day regatta in the world and, whether true or false, it is certainly a great occasion and a distinctively Auckland event. Waitemata Harbour is almost landlocked, and the action can be viewed from various parts of the city. The start line is near the mid point and, at the sound of the starter's gun, the yachts race across the waters, past the islands of the Hauraki Gulf before returning to the end of the harbour and making a final turn to race back to the line.
General.Body: Auckland celebrates its birthday with a grand regatta as it has since 1840. It is considered by some as the biggest one-day regatta in the world and, whether true or false, it is certainly a great occasion and a distinctively Auckland event. Waitemata Harbour is almost landlocked, and the action can be viewed from various parts of the city. The start line is near the mid point and, at the sound of the starter's gun, the yachts race across the waters, past the islands of the Hauraki Gulf before returning to the end of the harbour and making a final turn to race back to the line.

General.Teaser: Two days of feasting on the country’s finest produce and world-class wines.
General.Body: Two days of feasting on the country’s finest produce and world-class wines.

General.Teaser: The Kathmandu Jazz Festival attracts a host of talented musicians from around the world. Since it first started in 2002, the festival has grown in both popularity and size. Today the schedule includes concerts, free shows and a range of educational workshops, which take place at venues across Kathmandu.
General.Body: The Kathmandu Jazz Festival attracts a host of talented musicians from around the world. Since it first started in 2002, the festival has grown in both popularity and size. Today the schedule includes concerts, free shows and a range of educational workshops, which take place at venues across Kathmandu.

General.Teaser: Tihar is the second largest festival in Nepal and is celebrated by both Buddhists and Hindus. Known as the ‘Festival of Lights,’ towns across the country are illuminated throughout the five day jamboree. Gifts are exchanged between family members and gamblers are allowed to try their luck (placing bets is unrestricted during this holiday). The festival ends with a special day devoted to brothers who receive tikka blessings on their foreheads.
General.Body: Tihar is the second largest festival in Nepal and is celebrated by both Buddhists and Hindus. Known as the ‘Festival of Lights,’ towns across the country are illuminated throughout the five day jamboree. Gifts are exchanged between family members and gamblers are allowed to try their luck (placing bets is unrestricted during this holiday). The festival ends with a special day devoted to brothers who receive tikka blessings on their foreheads.

General.Teaser: Nepal’s most important festival lasts for 15-days, celebrating the victory of the Hindu Goddess Durga over the buffalo demon Mahisasura. To honour the bloodthirsty deity, huge numbers of goats, chickens and buffalo are sacrificed at temples across the valley.
General.Body: Nepal’s most important festival lasts for 15-days, celebrating the victory of the Hindu Goddess Durga over the buffalo demon Mahisasura. To honour the bloodthirsty deity, huge numbers of goats, chickens and buffalo are sacrificed at temples across the valley.

General.Teaser: The Nepali version of Diwali, the festival of lights. Animals are honoured with flower garlands and houses are decorated with butter lamps, candles and electric lights, while children fill the streets with fireworks.
General.Body: The Nepali version of Diwali, the festival of lights. Animals are honoured with flower garlands and houses are decorated with butter lamps, candles and electric lights, while children fill the streets with fireworks.

General.Teaser: The end of British rule is celebrated as a public holiday in Myanmar, and the occasion is marked with fairs and markets throughout the country, as well as sporting competitions such as races. There are also formal events in the capital Nay Pyi Taw.
General.Body: The end of British rule is celebrated as a public holiday in Myanmar, and the occasion is marked with fairs and markets throughout the country, as well as sporting competitions such as races. There are also formal events in the capital Nay Pyi Taw.

General.Teaser: Almost all active temples have their own annual festivals, usually from January to March. The paya pwe (temple festival) at Ananda Pahto is particularly large, and goes on for around a fortnight. Large numbers of monks visit the temple, and chanting goes on around the clock.
General.Body: Almost all active temples have their own annual festivals, usually from January to March. The paya pwe (temple festival) at Ananda Pahto is particularly large, and goes on for around a fortnight. Large numbers of monks visit the temple, and chanting goes on around the clock.

General.Teaser: This harvest festival takes place on the day of the full moon of Tabodwe month, and is marked by the communal cooking and eating of htamane (glutinous rice with coconut slices, sesame seeds and peanuts). There are team competitions and cooking demonstrations throughout the day.
General.Body: This harvest festival takes place on the day of the full moon of Tabodwe month, and is marked by the communal cooking and eating of htamane (glutinous rice with coconut slices, sesame seeds and peanuts). There are team competitions and cooking demonstrations throughout the day.

General.Teaser: The biggest event in the festival calendar, a riotous New Year celebration where everybody gets soaked as water is thrown to symbolise the washing away of the previous year’s ills. Buddhists perform acts to achieve merit, such as offering alms to monks and freeing caged birds. Foreigners can expect to get wet too.
General.Body: The biggest event in the festival calendar, a riotous New Year celebration where everybody gets soaked as water is thrown to symbolise the washing away of the previous year’s ills. Buddhists perform acts to achieve merit, such as offering alms to monks and freeing caged birds. Foreigners can expect to get wet too.

General.Teaser: This event at the beginning of the monsoon season marks the start of wa-dwin (often described as ‘Buddhist Lent’), with people donating new robes to monks. During the three months of wa-dwin monks are forbidden from leaving their monasteries overnight. Weddings are also not held during wa-dwin.
General.Body: This event at the beginning of the monsoon season marks the start of wa-dwin (often described as ‘Buddhist Lent’), with people donating new robes to monks. During the three months of wa-dwin monks are forbidden from leaving their monasteries overnight. Weddings are also not held during wa-dwin.

General.Teaser: This is wonderful time to visit Buddhist sites, as many of them are decked out with hundreds of candles. It marks the return of the Buddha to earth after preaching in heaven during the three months of Lent. Homes are also decorated with candles.
General.Body: This is wonderful time to visit Buddhist sites, as many of them are decked out with hundreds of candles. It marks the return of the Buddha to earth after preaching in heaven during the three months of Lent. Homes are also decorated with candles.

General.Teaser: The full moon of the month of Tazaungmon is marked with fireworks in many parts of the country, but is particularly exciting in Taunggyi where teams compete to launch the most spectacular firework displays by attaching them to hot air balloons. Accidents, and casualties, are not unknown.
General.Body: The full moon of the month of Tazaungmon is marked with fireworks in many parts of the country, but is particularly exciting in Taunggyi where teams compete to launch the most spectacular firework displays by attaching them to hot air balloons. Accidents, and casualties, are not unknown.

General.Teaser: Various ethnic minorities, including the Kayin, Kachin, Chin and Shan, have their own new year celebrations which are based on the lunar calendar. The events usually include live music and dancing, special markets, opportunities to gamble and plenty of fireworks.
General.Body: Various ethnic minorities, including the Kayin, Kachin, Chin and Shan, have their own new year celebrations which are based on the lunar calendar. The events usually include live music and dancing, special markets, opportunities to gamble and plenty of fireworks.

General.Teaser: GoMissing Expeditions invites you to visit the Valley of Flowers in Uttaranchal! See millions of rare flowers including the Blue Poppy and Cobra Lily bloom amongst thousands of herbs and plants endemic to the area. Our ace naturalist who will be accompanying you on the trip will point these flowers out to you and explain their characteristics & significance in this incredible ecosystem. Valley of flowers was declared a national park in 1982 and is now a world heritage site. Every few days, in the months of July and August, the valley changes color.
General.Body: GoMissing Expeditions invites you to visit the Valley of Flowers in Uttaranchal! See millions of rare flowers including the Blue Poppy and Cobra Lily bloom amongst thousands of herbs and plants endemic to the area. Our ace naturalist who will be accompanying you on the trip will point these flowers out to you and explain their characteristics & significance in this incredible ecosystem. Valley of flowers was declared a national park in 1982 and is now a world heritage site. Every few days, in the months of July and August, the valley changes color. It takes after the predominant color of the flowers growing in the valley. The legend goes that the valley is inhabited by fairies, and why not, a place of such astounding beauty has to be the abode of fairies! Join us as we seek out the elusive fairies and endangered species through the forested slopes, wander amongst the snow covered mountains and drink nectar off numerous waterfalls in the valley.

General.Teaser: The five-day Festival of Lights is the most important and pan-Indian of Hindu festivals, also marked by Jainists and Sikhs. It is celebrated by giving gifts, lighting fireworks and burning butter and oil lamps to lead Lord Rama home after his 14-year exile. It's a spectacular and colourful time in the Delhi calendar and well worth being around to witness, as the city dons a particularly festive appearance.
General.Body: The five-day Festival of Lights is the most important and pan-Indian of Hindu festivals, also marked by Jainists and Sikhs. It is celebrated by giving gifts, lighting fireworks and burning butter and oil lamps to lead Lord Rama home after his 14-year exile. It's a spectacular and colourful time in the Delhi calendar and well worth being around to witness, as the city dons a particularly festive appearance.

General.Teaser: This is one of the biggest Hindu festivals. It marks Rama and Sita's homecoming and includes the lighting of lamps and firecrackers, as well as the giving and receiving of sweets.
General.Body: This is one of the biggest Hindu festivals. It marks Rama and Sita's homecoming and includes the lighting of lamps and firecrackers, as well as the giving and receiving of sweets.

General.Teaser: Timed to coincide with the full moon, this Hindi water festival involves people throwing water, paint and coloured powders all over each other and is great fun to witness.
General.Body: Timed to coincide with the full moon, this Hindi water festival involves people throwing water, paint and coloured powders all over each other and is great fun to witness.

General.Teaser: Major Hindu festival; festival of lights punctuated with firecrackers from dawn and fireworks at night, new clothes and gifts of sweets, small candles lit at dusk outside homes.
General.Body: Major Hindu festival; festival of lights punctuated with firecrackers from dawn and fireworks at night, new clothes and gifts of sweets, small candles lit at dusk outside homes.

General.Teaser: One of the largest music and dance festivals in the world - a celebration of classical music and dance of South India (Carnatic style), which is held at a number of venues around the city. The city comes alive with the festival which has now developed into a cultural extravaganza with more than 2,000 participants. Performances include vocal and instrumental music as well as dance by artistes of all ages.
General.Body: One of the largest music and dance festivals in the world - a celebration of classical music and dance of South India (Carnatic style), which is held at a number of venues around the city. The city comes alive with the festival which has now developed into a cultural extravaganza with more than 2,000 participants. Performances include vocal and instrumental music as well as dance by artistes of all ages.

General.Teaser: Festival of lights with lamps and firecrackers celebrated on full moon. On this occasion, people clean their houses and light lamps, which are moved to different places in the house and are arranged near the doors, windows and balconies.
General.Body: Festival of lights with lamps and firecrackers celebrated on full moon. On this occasion, people clean their houses and light lamps, which are moved to different places in the house and are arranged near the doors, windows and balconies.

General.Teaser: The five-day 'Festival of Lights' is the most pan-Indian of Hindu festivals and is celebrated by giving gifts, lighting fireworks, and burning butter and oil lamps to lead Lord Rama home after his 14-year exile.
General.Body: The five-day 'Festival of Lights' is the most pan-Indian of Hindu festivals and is celebrated by giving gifts, lighting fireworks, and burning butter and oil lamps to lead Lord Rama home after his 14-year exile.

General.Teaser: This harvest celebration takes place at Icheon, one hour's bus journey from central Seoul. Activities include rice-cake making and there’s traditional cultural entertainment.
General.Body: This harvest celebration takes place at Icheon, one hour's bus journey from central Seoul. Activities include rice-cake making and there’s traditional cultural entertainment.

General.Teaser: This annual cultural celebration showcases Seoul’s unique history, tradition and diversity through performing arts. It takes on a different theme each year.
General.Body: This annual cultural celebration showcases Seoul’s unique history, tradition and diversity through performing arts. It takes on a different theme each year.
General.VenueName: Yeouido Hangang Park and downtown Seoul.

General.Teaser: A big night in Jakarta with street festivities counting down to the changing of the year.
General.Body: A big night in Jakarta with street festivities counting down to the changing of the year.

General.Teaser: One million people pass through the sixth century Imamiya Ebisu Shrine during the three-day January festival to pray to Ebisu (or informally, 'Ebessan'), the god of business and wealth. The shrine maidens sell lucky bamboo fronds (fukusasa) loaded with lucky charms and coin talismans. Their offer is: 'Buy a frond and your business will prosper'. It's certainly a profitable time for the frond sellers. The highlight of the festival is 'Toka Ebisu' (10th Ebisu) when colourful palanquins bear geisha and other celebrities through the lantern-lit streets.
General.Body: One million people pass through the sixth century Imamiya Ebisu Shrine during the three-day January festival to pray to Ebisu (or informally, 'Ebessan'), the god of business and wealth. The shrine maidens sell lucky bamboo fronds (fukusasa) loaded with lucky charms and coin talismans. Their offer is: 'Buy a frond and your business will prosper'. It's certainly a profitable time for the frond sellers. The highlight of the festival is 'Toka Ebisu' (10th Ebisu) when colourful palanquins bear geisha and other celebrities through the lantern-lit streets.

General.Teaser: Osaka's Shinnosai Festival is dedicated to the guardian god of Doshomachi, Osaka's medicine district, and to Shinno, the divine founder of medicine from China.
General.Body: Osaka's Shinnosai Festival is dedicated to the guardian god of Doshomachi, Osaka's medicine district, and to Shinno, the divine founder of medicine from China.

General.Teaser: The Hagoita-Ichi (Battledore Fair) is an annual fair held at the Sensoji Temple in Asakusa. Street stalls sell all shapes and sizes of hagoita - decorative wooden bats used as lucky charms. In the past they were used to play a form of badminton. Traditionally they are decorated with colourful portraits of kabuki actors, but today they may equally portray pop stars or characters from mangas (comics).
General.Body: The Hagoita-Ichi (Battledore Fair) is an annual fair held at the Sensoji Temple in Asakusa. Street stalls sell all shapes and sizes of hagoita - decorative wooden bats used as lucky charms. In the past they were used to play a form of badminton. Traditionally they are decorated with colourful portraits of kabuki actors, but today they may equally portray pop stars or characters from mangas (comics).

General.Teaser: After the convenient bonenkai parties, designed to forget the old year and start the new one with a clean slate, New Year in Japan signals the start of a major holiday. Unlike the West, it’s important to see the first sunrise rather than the switching of the clock from 23:59 to 00:00. People display pine and bamboo ornaments and it’s traditional to visit a shrine.
General.Body: After the convenient bonenkai parties, designed to forget the old year and start the new one with a clean slate, New Year in Japan signals the start of a major holiday. Unlike the West, it’s important to see the first sunrise rather than the switching of the clock from 23:59 to 00:00. People display pine and bamboo ornaments and it’s traditional to visit a shrine.
General.VenueName: Shrines across the city, but the Meiji Shrine in particular.

General.DateDescription: The next event will be held in autumn of 2019.
General.Teaser: The huge Tokyo Motor Show promises to examine "next-generation automobiles and the social systems with which they interact". Expect to hear a lot about solar power and “low carbon” while surrounded by plenty of automobiles.
General.Body: The huge Tokyo Motor Show promises to examine "next-generation automobiles and the social systems with which they interact". Expect to hear a lot about solar power and “low carbon” while surrounded by plenty of automobiles.

General.Teaser: Japan's annual film extravaganza is held at various venues throughout the metropolis. Expect an international display that leaves you with plenty to think about.
General.Body: Japan's annual film extravaganza is held at various venues throughout the metropolis. Expect an international display that leaves you with plenty to think about.
General.VenueName: TOHO Cinemas Roppongi Hills and Cinemart Roppongi.

General.Teaser: For a lavish display of portable shrines and floats, visit Tokyo during the three-day festival that honours the deities of the Kanda Myojin Shrine. Worshippers parade ornate golden mikoshi (portable shrines) through the streets in one of the three largest festivals in Japan. Revel in the Edokko spirit, famed for knowing how to have a good time.
General.Body: For a lavish display of portable shrines and floats, visit Tokyo during the three-day festival that honours the deities of the Kanda Myojin Shrine. Worshippers parade ornate golden mikoshi (portable shrines) through the streets in one of the three largest festivals in Japan. Revel in the Edokko spirit, famed for knowing how to have a good time.

General.Teaser: In an unusual mix of acrobatics and health and safety, firemen in Edo-period costume perform circus stunts on top of bamboo ladders to remind the whole city about the importance of fire prevention. There’s a good reason for this, though. The Tokyo firefighting organisation dates back to 1557, when a massive fire swept through wooden old Tokyo and killed over 100,000 people.
General.Body: In an unusual mix of acrobatics and health and safety, firemen in Edo-period costume perform circus stunts on top of bamboo ladders to remind the whole city about the importance of fire prevention. There’s a good reason for this, though. The Tokyo firefighting organisation dates back to 1557, when a massive fire swept through wooden old Tokyo and killed over 100,000 people.

General.Teaser: The Indian Festival of Lights celebration takes place on the main road of Little India, which is decorated with many colourful and bright lights, street decorations and fireworks. Traditional and culture activities, street parade, concerts and impressive bazaars with traditional clothing, saris, oil lamps, fragrant flowers and jewellery all come together, as well as delicious Indian food.
General.Body: The Indian Festival of Lights celebration takes place on the main road of Little India, which is decorated with many colourful and bright lights, street decorations and fireworks. Traditional and culture activities, street parade, concerts and impressive bazaars with traditional clothing, saris, oil lamps, fragrant flowers and jewellery all come together, as well as delicious Indian food.

General.Teaser: Commemoration of Singapore's independence from Malaysia in 1965, this national day has parades and fireworks.
General.Body: Commemoration of Singapore's independence from Malaysia in 1965, this national day has parades and fireworks.

General.Teaser: Celebrations commemorating the end of the American War.
General.Body: Celebrations commemorating the end of the American War.

General.Teaser: Following Liberation Day this gives citizens a two-day holiday.
General.Body: Following Liberation Day this gives citizens a two-day holiday.

General.Teaser: Celebrated by the small Christian community but increasingly seen as a party period by other groups.
General.Body: Celebrated by the small Christian community but increasingly seen as a party period by other groups.

General.Teaser: The most important festival of the year timed according to the lunar calendar.
General.Body: The most important festival of the year timed according to the lunar calendar.

General.Teaser: Parades and celebration by women.
General.Body: Parades and celebration by women.

General.Teaser: The Sepang 12 Hour (MMER) is a 12-hour endurance race for cars between 1600-1900cc. First held in 2000, this has grown to become one of the biggest events of its kind in Malaysia. It's seen as a good training ground for the racing stars of the future.
General.Body: The Sepang 12 Hour (MMER) is a 12-hour endurance race for cars between 1600-1900cc. First held in 2000, this has grown to become one of the biggest events of its kind in Malaysia. It's seen as a good training ground for the racing stars of the future.

General.Teaser: The annual Malaysian Motorcycle Grand Prix is one of Kuala Lumpur's best-loved sporting events. Held at the spectacular Sepang International Circuit, this is a highlight of the sporting calendar and huge crowd gather to soak up the noise, excitement and the distinctive smell of super-charged engines.
General.Body: The annual Malaysian Motorcycle Grand Prix is one of Kuala Lumpur's best-loved sporting events. Held at the spectacular Sepang International Circuit, this is a highlight of the sporting calendar and huge crowd gather to soak up the noise, excitement and the distinctive smell of super-charged engines.

General.Teaser: The famous 'Festival of Lights' is one of the most popular Hindu celebrations, commemorating the triumph of good over evil. As with the Chinese New Year, every community joins in the celebrations, lighting candles, lanterns and fireworks to bring good luck. This is a public holiday in most of the country, including KL.
General.Body: The famous 'Festival of Lights' is one of the most popular Hindu celebrations, commemorating the triumph of good over evil. As with the Chinese New Year, every community joins in the celebrations, lighting candles, lanterns and fireworks to bring good luck. This is a public holiday in most of the country, including KL.

General.Teaser: The Shanghai Biennale is a series of talks, lectures, exhibitions and installations in various venues throughout Shanghai. Each biennale tackles a particular theme through a series of innovative and challenging displays and exhibitions.
General.Body: The Shanghai Biennale is a series of talks, lectures, exhibitions and installations in various venues throughout Shanghai. Each biennale tackles a particular theme through a series of innovative and challenging displays and exhibitions.

General.Teaser: A month of live music, dance, theatre, magic and exhibitions culminating in the Shanghai Biennale.
General.Body: A month of live music, dance, theatre, magic and exhibitions culminating in the Shanghai Biennale.

General.Teaser: Also known as Spring Festival in modern-day mainland China, the Chinese New Year celebrations is China’s largest national festival and is celebrated with fervour across the city. It is a seven day festival beginning on Chinese New Year.
General.Body: Also known as Spring Festival in modern-day mainland China, the Chinese New Year celebrations is China’s largest national festival and is celebrated with fervour across the city. It is a seven day festival beginning on Chinese New Year.

General.Teaser: Now held at the Beijing Olympic Green Centre, this ATP elite tour event attracts many of the world's best tennis players.
General.Body: Now held at the Beijing Olympic Green Centre, this ATP elite tour event attracts many of the world's best tennis players.

General.Teaser: One of the biggest New Year parties in Thailand, Bangkok's New Year Countdown is a fabulous celebration which attracts revellers from all over the world. Highlights from the evening entertainment programme include a beer festival, crafts market and performances by some of the country's biggest and best-known singers, actors and musicians. And on the stroke of midnight, an incredible fireworks display announces the arrival of the New Year which is broadcast live on Thai television.
General.Body: One of the biggest New Year parties in Thailand, Bangkok's New Year Countdown is a fabulous celebration which attracts revellers from all over the world. Highlights from the evening entertainment programme include a beer festival, crafts market and performances by some of the country's biggest and best-known singers, actors and musicians. And on the stroke of midnight, an incredible fireworks display announces the arrival of the New Year which is broadcast live on Thai television. Many of Bangkok's bigger shops and department stores also hold special sales with plenty of bargains to be found.

General.Teaser: Public holiday in memory of Rama V, who died in 1910 but is remembered as one of the great kings of Siam. The celebrations are best seen at the Equestrian Statue in the Royal Plaza.
General.Body: Public holiday in memory of Rama V, who died in 1910 but is remembered as one of the great kings of Siam. The celebrations are best seen at the Equestrian Statue in the Royal Plaza.

General.Teaser: This film festival has been run successfully since 2003, and grows in stature and size with every passing year.
General.Body: This film festival has been run successfully since 2003, and grows in stature and size with every passing year.

General.Teaser: Ran along a course through the centre of this bustling city, the annual Bangkok Marathon takes participants on a route that includes many of the city's famous landmarks. Passing the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, the National Museum and the Chao Phraya River, there are many scenic spots from which to watch the action. But one of the best places to watch the marathon is on Sanam Chai Road next to the famous Grand Palace which is where the race starts and finishes.
General.Body: Ran along a course through the centre of this bustling city, the annual Bangkok Marathon takes participants on a route that includes many of the city's famous landmarks. Passing the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, the National Museum and the Chao Phraya River, there are many scenic spots from which to watch the action. But one of the best places to watch the marathon is on Sanam Chai Road next to the famous Grand Palace which is where the race starts and finishes. In addition to the full 42km (26 miles) marathon course, there are also the shorter 10.5km (6.5 miles) quarter marathon course and the 5km (3.2 miles) course for slower runners and walkers. A great atmosphere prevails and there are numerous events after the race, including the popular pasta party.

Address.Address2: Picturesque route through the main streets of Bangkok. The marathon begins and ends next to the Grand Palace

General.Body: This colourful event celebrated its tenth anniversary in 2013, and continues to provide a high-profile showcase for Sri Lankan designers. During the three days of festivities, a variety of workshops, catwalk shows and fashion-focussed events are held around the capital. The emphasis is on traditional clothing, but fashion aficionados will also find plenty of modern collections to take their fancy.

General.Teaser: Welcoming the arrival of the warmer weather, the April Jazz Espoo is a popular spring-time event that attracts music fans from all over the country and beyond. The festival is the largest annual jazz event in the Helsinki Metropolitan Area and always attracts a great selection of bands and musicians from all over the world. Performances take place in a number of different venues with plenty on offer to suit all tastes. There are also a number of after-hours parties and club events which keep the feet stomping late into the night.
General.Body: Welcoming the arrival of the warmer weather, the April Jazz Espoo is a popular spring-time event that attracts music fans from all over the country and beyond. The festival is the largest annual jazz event in the Helsinki Metropolitan Area and always attracts a great selection of bands and musicians from all over the world. Performances take place in a number of different venues with plenty on offer to suit all tastes. There are also a number of after-hours parties and club events which keep the feet stomping late into the night.

General.Teaser: Founded in 1970, Ruisrock is the oldest rock festival in Finland and the second oldest in Europe. Held on the island of Ruissalo in Turku, it attracts over 100,000 spectators and has previously hosted acts such as The Kinks, The Clash, Bob Dylan, David Bowie, Nirvana, and Iron Maiden.
General.Body: Founded in 1970, Ruisrock is the oldest rock festival in Finland and the second oldest in Europe. Held on the island of Ruissalo in Turku, it attracts over 100,000 spectators and has previously hosted acts such as The Kinks, The Clash, Bob Dylan, David Bowie, Nirvana, and Iron Maiden.

General.Teaser: Like their neighbour Sweden, Finland also makes a big deal out of midsummer celebrations – but with their own twist. The centrepiece of the celebrations is not a maypole, but rather a kokko (bonfire), as well as the usual drinking and partying. Most people spend the holiday at their summer cottage, so expect cities and towns to be empty. Head to Seurasaari island and join in the festival celebrations there, or go into the woods to pick seven different wildflowers – legend is you will then see the love of your life in your dreams.
General.Body: Like their neighbour Sweden, Finland also makes a big deal out of midsummer celebrations – but with their own twist. The centrepiece of the celebrations is not a maypole, but rather a kokko (bonfire), as well as the usual drinking and partying. Most people spend the holiday at their summer cottage, so expect cities and towns to be empty. Head to Seurasaari island and join in the festival celebrations there, or go into the woods to pick seven different wildflowers – legend is you will then see the love of your life in your dreams.
General.VenueName: Various celebrations take place across the country

General.EventCost: Prices vary; some events are free. 3-day ticket for the concert park from €179.
General.Teaser: With a long history that stretches back to 1966, the festival has a well-earned reputation as one of the biggest and best jazz festivals in Europe. Attracting over 100,000 visitors during its nine-day duration, visitors to this event can expect an audio feast of jazz music that embraces the genre in all its weird and wonderful forms. Past performers have ranged from such classics as Chuck Berry and James Brown to more contemporary acts such as Craig David and Alicia Keys. But whatever your tastes, this is a fabulous festival that is popular with music fans young and old.
General.Body: With a long history that stretches back to 1966, the festival has a well-earned reputation as one of the biggest and best jazz festivals in Europe. Attracting over 100,000 visitors during its nine-day duration, visitors to this event can expect an audio feast of jazz music that embraces the genre in all its weird and wonderful forms. Past performers have ranged from such classics as Chuck Berry and James Brown to more contemporary acts such as Craig David and Alicia Keys. But whatever your tastes, this is a fabulous festival that is popular with music fans young and old.
General.VenueName: Kirjurinluoto Concert Park, as well as smaller venues

General.Teaser: The annual Naantali Music Festival presents a packed programme of performances by artists from all over the world. First organised in 1980 by the acclaimed cellist Professor Arto Noras, the festival includes an exciting programme of chamber music. Most performances take place in the local churches, particularly Naantali church, which was consecrated in 1462. There is also a festival cruise that goes to the island of Seili in the Turku archipelago.
General.Body: The annual Naantali Music Festival presents a packed programme of performances by artists from all over the world. First organised in 1980 by the acclaimed cellist Professor Arto Noras, the festival includes an exciting programme of chamber music. Most performances take place in the local churches, particularly Naantali church, which was consecrated in 1462. There is also a festival cruise that goes to the island of Seili in the Turku archipelago.

General.Teaser: Taking place each July in the coastal town of Kotka in the southeast of the country is the annual Maritime Festival. The event takes place at the height of summer attracting visitors from across the region for a fun event involving nautical displays, street theatre, live music and a market selling all manner of nautically-related goods and wares. A Children's Maritime Festival is held at the same time and features a range of theatre, music and conjuring.
General.Body: Taking place each July in the coastal town of Kotka in the southeast of the country is the annual Maritime Festival. The event takes place at the height of summer attracting visitors from across the region for a fun event involving nautical displays, street theatre, live music and a market selling all manner of nautically-related goods and wares. A Children's Maritime Festival is held at the same time and features a range of theatre, music and conjuring.

General.Teaser: Thousands of people jump into rubber boats to float down the Vantaa river while drinking beer and enjoying the sunshine. If you do not have a boat, the website has instructions on where to buy one, although there will usually be people selling them on-site as well. When you’re done floating, head to the afterparty at Crazy Horse bar in Helsinki. This annual event has no official organiser.
General.Body: Thousands of people jump into rubber boats to float down the Vantaa river while drinking beer and enjoying the sunshine. If you do not have a boat, the website has instructions on where to buy one, although there will usually be people selling them on-site as well. When you’re done floating, head to the afterparty at Crazy Horse bar in Helsinki. This annual event has no official organiser.

General.DateDescription: Usually the first weekend in April .
General.Teaser: The Reindeer Championship Races is the highlight of the reindeer racing year. They are held on the icy terrain of Lapland’s biggest lake, Lake Inari. There are also other unusual events like a lassoing contest, handicrafts, market stalls, local food and, of course, a lot of reindeers.
General.Body: The Reindeer Championship Races is the highlight of the reindeer racing year. They are held on the icy terrain of Lapland’s biggest lake, Lake Inari. There are also other unusual events like a lassoing contest, handicrafts, market stalls, local food and, of course, a lot of reindeers.

General.Teaser: This fishing event is a series of ice fishing competitions held around the Enontekiö municipality. Travellers can tour the region, take part in the competitions, meet local people and experience the local culture.
General.Body: This fishing event is a series of ice fishing competitions held around the Enontekiö municipality. Travellers can tour the region, take part in the competitions, meet local people and experience the local culture.

General.Teaser: Celebrating St Mary's Day in Hetta, Enontekiö, is an old Sámi tradition. There are lots of activities and events, all related to the Sámi Culture, from reindeer races to traditional Sámi handicrafts.
General.Body: Celebrating St Mary's Day in Hetta, Enontekiö, is an old Sámi tradition. There are lots of activities and events, all related to the Sámi Culture, from reindeer races to traditional Sámi handicrafts.

General.Teaser: The northernmost cross country ski marathon in the world, 500 competitors race from Enontekiö in Finland to Kautokeino in Norway, both central villages in the Sámi cultural area.
General.Body: The northernmost cross country ski marathon in the world, 500 competitors race from Enontekiö in Finland to Kautokeino in Norway, both central villages in the Sámi cultural area.

General.Teaser: The Black and White Theatre Festival is an alternative theatre event promoting puppetry, dance and pantomime. It's held in Imatra in the Samiaa region along the South East border of Finland.
General.Body: The Black and White Theatre Festival is an alternative theatre event promoting puppetry, dance and pantomime. It's held in Imatra in the Samiaa region along the South East border of Finland.

General.Teaser: The Midnight Sun Film Festival takes place in the village of Sodankylä, 120 kilometres north of the Arctic Circle boundary. Since it takes place during the summer months, the sun never sets, taking the entire experience one step further. A great festival for cinema buffs, the festival sees a host of well known directors, actors and movie enthusiasts from across the globe. There are movies spanning a variety of genres and eras along with silent movies accompanied by live music.
General.Body: The Midnight Sun Film Festival takes place in the village of Sodankylä, 120 kilometres north of the Arctic Circle boundary. Since it takes place during the summer months, the sun never sets, taking the entire experience one step further. A great festival for cinema buffs, the festival sees a host of well known directors, actors and movie enthusiasts from across the globe. There are movies spanning a variety of genres and eras along with silent movies accompanied by live music.

General.EventCost: €50 Participation fee. Admission €25, children age 7-12 €5, children under 7 free.
General.Teaser: The Wife Carrying World Championships is an annual event which has been held in the small town of Sonkajärvi since its inception in 1992. The aim of the competition is for men to win a relay race with their wives on their shoulders; they must run along a 250m track which contains a number of dry obstacles and one water obstacle. The carried woman does not necessarily have to be the wife of the carrier but has to be over 17 years old and weigh at least 50kg. The winner gets the weight of their wife in beer.
General.Body: The Wife Carrying World Championships is an annual event which has been held in the small town of Sonkajärvi since its inception in 1992. The aim of the competition is for men to win a relay race with their wives on their shoulders; they must run along a 250m track which contains a number of dry obstacles and one water obstacle. The carried woman does not necessarily have to be the wife of the carrier but has to be over 17 years old and weigh at least 50kg. The winner gets the weight of their wife in beer.

General.Teaser: Fishermen have been gathering round Helsinki Market Square at the beginning of October to sell their wares ever since the 18th century. The tradition continues to this day when Helsinki hosts the Baltic Herring Fair, one of the city's oldest traditional events. The market is packed with salted, pickled and marinated fish and special events also take place. As well as traditional marinade recipes, there are also exotic options on offer too ranging from lemon and rowanberry to cayenne pepper and garlic.
General.Body: Fishermen have been gathering round Helsinki Market Square at the beginning of October to sell their wares ever since the 18th century. The tradition continues to this day when Helsinki hosts the Baltic Herring Fair, one of the city's oldest traditional events. The market is packed with salted, pickled and marinated fish and special events also take place. As well as traditional marinade recipes, there are also exotic options on offer too ranging from lemon and rowanberry to cayenne pepper and garlic. Some stalls also sell items such as socks, hats and jumpers made from the wool of sheep living on the remote islands, as well as loaves of the delicious black bread so popular in the Finnish archipelago. On the Saturday of the Helsinki Baltic Herring Fair, traditional sailing ships race each other just off the Helsinki shore, where crowds gather to watch the spectacle. After the race, the ships dock at Market Square for the sailors to attend the Traditional Sailing Ship Meet on the Sunday. The ships are also open for the public to jump on board and look around.

General.Teaser: Several stalls selling Christmas treats and seasonal crafts line the street of Esplanade Park and Aleksanterinkatu. The Lucia Parade is another seasonal favourite; starting from Senate Square, the parade features elves, horses and historic cars.
General.Body: Several stalls selling Christmas treats and seasonal crafts line the street of Esplanade Park and Aleksanterinkatu. The Lucia Parade is another seasonal favourite; starting from Senate Square, the parade features elves, horses and historic cars.

General.Teaser: A series of jazz concerts kicks off the first jazz event of its kind in Helsinki each winter. Local and international artists will take to the stage at a number of different venues throughout the city.
General.Body: A series of jazz concerts kicks off the first jazz event of its kind in Helsinki each winter. Local and international artists will take to the stage at a number of different venues throughout the city.

General.Teaser: When Helsinki plunges into darkness during the long, winter, Lux Helsinki literally lights up the city centre with magical light art. The main route stretches from the Olympic Stadium past the Amphitheatre at the Finnish National Opera, Hesperia Park, Kansalaistori and Kiasma to Baana and Senate Square. Impressive light installations by Finnish and international artists can be viewed every night when the sun sets.
General.Body: When Helsinki plunges into darkness during the long, winter, Lux Helsinki literally lights up the city centre with magical light art. The main route stretches from the Olympic Stadium past the Amphitheatre at the Finnish National Opera, Hesperia Park, Kansalaistori and Kiasma to Baana and Senate Square. Impressive light installations by Finnish and international artists can be viewed every night when the sun sets.

General.Teaser: New Year’s Eve has been celebrated at Senate Square since 1932. Thousands of people gather to celebrate to enjoy musical performances, traditional speeches, greetings and songs. The festivities culminate in brilliant fireworks, after which the partying continues throughout the night all around town.
General.Body: New Year’s Eve has been celebrated at Senate Square since 1932. Thousands of people gather to celebrate to enjoy musical performances, traditional speeches, greetings and songs. The festivities culminate in brilliant fireworks, after which the partying continues throughout the night all around town.

General.Teaser: Named after the river that runs through Katowice, this international festival brings together some of the greatest blues performers from around the world. It's been running since 1981.
General.Body: Named after the river that runs through Katowice, this international festival brings together some of the greatest blues performers from around the world. It's been running since 1981.

General.Teaser: A sprinkling of snow and Rynek Glowny’s Gothic architecture provide the perfect backdrop to Christmas celebrations in Cracow. A market selling anything from local crafts to mulled wine attracts thousands of visitors every year. There is also a competition to find the best nativity scenes in the city.
General.Body: A sprinkling of snow and Rynek Glowny’s Gothic architecture provide the perfect backdrop to Christmas celebrations in Cracow. A market selling anything from local crafts to mulled wine attracts thousands of visitors every year. There is also a competition to find the best nativity scenes in the city.

General.Teaser: One of Europe’s largest New Year celebrations, as many as 100,000 revellers gather in Cracow’s Main Market Square on the last evening of the year. Tourists and locals brave the bitter weather for a special programme of music and firework displays.
General.Body: One of Europe’s largest New Year celebrations, as many as 100,000 revellers gather in Cracow’s Main Market Square on the last evening of the year. Tourists and locals brave the bitter weather for a special programme of music and firework displays.

General.Teaser: Celebrated all over Poland but particularly in the bigger towns and cities, New Year's Eve is a great time to be in Warsaw. Many people throng into the Old Town Square close to the Wisla River for a spectacular fireworks display. Most restaurants, theatres, clubs and bars hold some kind of event on New Year's Eve and those that want to keep on partying after the stroke of midnight have no shortage of options to choose from.
General.Body: Celebrated all over Poland but particularly in the bigger towns and cities, New Year's Eve is a great time to be in Warsaw. Many people throng into the Old Town Square close to the Wisla River for a spectacular fireworks display. Most restaurants, theatres, clubs and bars hold some kind of event on New Year's Eve and those that want to keep on partying after the stroke of midnight have no shortage of options to choose from.
General.VenueName: Old town square, Vistula riverbanks and various other venues and locations throughout the city.

General.EventCost: Walking tour is free, food and wine prices vary.
General.Teaser: In southern Moravia, the small town of Hustopeče plays host every spring to an almond and wine festival. Visitors can see the white and pink flowers on the almond orchards (by scaling the observation tower or joining a walking tour on Hustopeče Hill), dine in local restaurants to sample almond-infused dishes, and head to the welcoming cellars of Hustopeče's vintners.
General.Body: In southern Moravia, the small town of Hustopeče plays host every spring to an almond and wine festival. Visitors can see the white and pink flowers on the almond orchards (by scaling the observation tower or joining a walking tour on Hustopeče Hill), dine in local restaurants to sample almond-infused dishes, and head to the welcoming cellars of Hustopeče's vintners.

General.Teaser: Always a big draw, the Prague Christmas Markets brim with an abundance of traditional food and gifts, and plenty to entertain kids of all ages. Held on the Old Town Square, Wenceslas Square, Havelska Street and Namesti Republiky. The most impressive is probably the one held in the Old Town Square, which transforms into a vast winter wonderland featuring an ice rink and a 27m (90ft) Christmas tree complete with carol singers.
General.Body: Always a big draw, the Prague Christmas Markets brim with an abundance of traditional food and gifts, and plenty to entertain kids of all ages. Held on the Old Town Square, Wenceslas Square, Havelska Street and Namesti Republiky. The most impressive is probably the one held in the Old Town Square, which transforms into a vast winter wonderland featuring an ice rink and a 27m (90ft) Christmas tree complete with carol singers.
General.VenueName: Old Town Square, Wenceslas Square, Namesti Republiky.

General.Teaser: Known locally as St Sylvester’s Eve long before it became plain old New Year's Eve, the citizens of Prague have always taken this night seriously when it comes to partying. Celebrations are mainly focused around Old Town Square and Wenceslas Square, with dancing crowds, roadside champagne stalls, classical concerts and the ancient spires of city’s famous skyline silhouetted by a dazzling display of fireworks.
General.Body: Known locally as St Sylvester’s Eve long before it became plain old New Year's Eve, the citizens of Prague have always taken this night seriously when it comes to partying. Celebrations are mainly focused around Old Town Square and Wenceslas Square, with dancing crowds, roadside champagne stalls, classical concerts and the ancient spires of city’s famous skyline silhouetted by a dazzling display of fireworks.

General.Teaser: Santa was modelled, as we know, on the earlier St Nicholas. On the eve of the saint's day (known locally as 'Little Christmas'), reincarnations of the jolly fellow roll through the streets of Prague handing out sweets to kids and dropping into bars for a beer. Each is accompanied by an angel or devil, representing reward and punishments, while St Nicholas himself signifies confession. Make friends with an angel for a treat - the devil doles out coal.
General.Body: Santa was modelled, as we know, on the earlier St Nicholas. On the eve of the saint's day (known locally as 'Little Christmas'), reincarnations of the jolly fellow roll through the streets of Prague handing out sweets to kids and dropping into bars for a beer. Each is accompanied by an angel or devil, representing reward and punishments, while St Nicholas himself signifies confession. Make friends with an angel for a treat - the devil doles out coal.

General.Teaser: This is Moscow’s most prestigious drama, ballet and opera festival showcasing the most significant premiers to come out of the previous year. All genres of the theatre arts are catered for, from puppetry to high end drama. The festival incorporates the National Theatre Awards, which, since their launch in 1993, have now become the country’s most prestigious theatre awards.
General.Body: This is Moscow’s most prestigious drama, ballet and opera festival showcasing the most significant premiers to come out of the previous year. All genres of the theatre arts are catered for, from puppetry to high end drama. The festival incorporates the National Theatre Awards, which, since their launch in 1993, have now become the country’s most prestigious theatre awards.

General.Teaser: The brainchild of Yuri Temirkanov, conductor of the St Petersburg Academic Philharmonic, this festival brings the wintery streets to life with classical concerts, recitals and fireworks.
General.Body: The brainchild of Yuri Temirkanov, conductor of the St Petersburg Academic Philharmonic, this festival brings the wintery streets to life with classical concerts, recitals and fireworks.
General.VenueName: Theatres, museums and concert halls around the city.

General.Teaser: Communists come out of the woodwork to parade and flag-wave to commemorate the October Revolution.
General.Body: Communists come out of the woodwork to parade and flag-wave to commemorate the October Revolution.

General.Teaser: Muscovites get into the Russian winter spirit with all sorts of special events and rides in troikas (sleighs drawn by three horses). Ice sculpture competitions, and even ice chess, also take place in the city.
General.Body: Muscovites get into the Russian winter spirit with all sorts of special events and rides in troikas (sleighs drawn by three horses). Ice sculpture competitions, and even ice chess, also take place in the city.
General.VenueName: Izmaylovsky Park, Pushkinsaya ploschad, Red Square and other venues.

General.Teaser: Celebrated according to the Julian calendar, the Russian Orthodox Christmas falls on 7 January and is a huge celebration for Orthodox Christians across Russia. Events begin on the eve of the holiday with a special televised speech by the president. Many attend Christmas religious services which are held in churches throughout Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. The Midnight Mass service on Christmas Eve in the restored Christ the Saviour Cathedral near the Kremlin is one of the main services.
General.Body: Celebrated according to the Julian calendar, the Russian Orthodox Christmas falls on 7 January and is a huge celebration for Orthodox Christians across Russia. Events begin on the eve of the holiday with a special televised speech by the president. Many attend Christmas religious services which are held in churches throughout Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. The Midnight Mass service on Christmas Eve in the restored Christ the Saviour Cathedral near the Kremlin is one of the main services.

General.Teaser: Maslenitsa is a blend of pagan beliefs and Christian traditions and is the Russian equivalent of Mardi Gras - the last period for feasting before the fasting of the traditional Lent season. Blini are a type of Russian pastry or doughnut which is frequently eaten smothered in jam, honey or other sweet foodstuffs. Maslenitsa lasts for up to one week ending on Shrove Tuesday or 'Blini Day'. Many Muscovites visit the Blini Village in Red Square which is a great place to soak up the unique flavour of this popular cultural and religious celebration.
General.Body: Maslenitsa is a blend of pagan beliefs and Christian traditions and is the Russian equivalent of Mardi Gras - the last period for feasting before the fasting of the traditional Lent season. Blini are a type of Russian pastry or doughnut which is frequently eaten smothered in jam, honey or other sweet foodstuffs. Maslenitsa lasts for up to one week ending on Shrove Tuesday or 'Blini Day'. Many Muscovites visit the Blini Village in Red Square which is a great place to soak up the unique flavour of this popular cultural and religious celebration.

General.Teaser: The annual classic car event brings together the twin thrills of seeing beautiful classic cars (dating from pre-1930s to mid-70s) up close and witnessing them race round the Valletta ring road at speed. Enjoy tours of historic sites and wine-tasting sessions in the run up to the main events, the Concours d'Elegance where the cars will be on display, and later, the 1km sprint run.
General.Body: The annual classic car event brings together the twin thrills of seeing beautiful classic cars (dating from pre-1930s to mid-70s) up close and witnessing them race round the Valletta ring road at speed. Enjoy tours of historic sites and wine-tasting sessions in the run up to the main events, the Concours d'Elegance where the cars will be on display, and later, the 1km sprint run.

General.Teaser: Held annually over a week since 1968, this is a highly rated offshore classic yachting event, off Valletta.
General.Body: Held annually over a week since 1968, this is a highly rated offshore classic yachting event, off Valletta.

General.Teaser: Ice skating race, in which skaters cover a nearly 200 km course of naturally frozen waterways around the province of Friesland in a single day. Starting in the capital of Leeuwarden, the competition proceeds clockwise through the chief eleven towns of the province, hence the name. Note: the Elfstedentocht only goes on when the ice is at least 15 cm thick.
General.Body: Ice skating race, in which skaters cover a nearly 200 km course of naturally frozen waterways around the province of Friesland in a single day. Starting in the capital of Leeuwarden, the competition proceeds clockwise through the chief eleven towns of the province, hence the name. Note: the Elfstedentocht only goes on when the ice is at least 15 cm thick.

General.Teaser: One of Europe's top film festivals, the IFFR is known for attracting independent, edgy, controversial films, with an emphasis on films from Asia and developing nations. In general, it is a less exclusive affair than its counterparts in Cannes and Venice, and attendees have ample opportunities to meet the filmmakers.
General.Body: One of Europe's top film festivals, the IFFR is known for attracting independent, edgy, controversial films, with an emphasis on films from Asia and developing nations. In general, it is a less exclusive affair than its counterparts in Cannes and Venice, and attendees have ample opportunities to meet the filmmakers.

General.Teaser: In November, a major parade marks the arrival of Saint Nicholas (Sinterklaas) from Spain, along with hundreds of his sooty-faced helpers known as Zwarte Pieten (Black Peters). The white-bearded character and his entourage sail up the Amstel into central Amsterdam and then ride horses down to Dam Square as the Peters hurl ginger biscuits to the thousands of children in attendance. The spectacle is a prelude to the December’s gift-giving ritual.
General.Body: In November, a major parade marks the arrival of Saint Nicholas (Sinterklaas) from Spain, along with hundreds of his sooty-faced helpers known as Zwarte Pieten (Black Peters). The white-bearded character and his entourage sail up the Amstel into central Amsterdam and then ride horses down to Dam Square as the Peters hurl ginger biscuits to the thousands of children in attendance. The spectacle is a prelude to the December’s gift-giving ritual.

General.Teaser: The annual International Documentary Festival Amsterdam (IDFA) screens a programme of documentaries that rise above the ordinary. Dedicated to innovative documentaries that challenge and inspire, the IDFA seeks out some of the very best films of the genre that address social problems or raise important issues. This is a great event at which to watch films that don't conform to the conventional mainstream output.
General.Body: The annual International Documentary Festival Amsterdam (IDFA) screens a programme of documentaries that rise above the ordinary. Dedicated to innovative documentaries that challenge and inspire, the IDFA seeks out some of the very best films of the genre that address social problems or raise important issues. This is a great event at which to watch films that don't conform to the conventional mainstream output.

General.Teaser: This celebration of Amsterdam's cultural bounty turns into a big bash. Pass holders are entitled access to 50 museums from 1800, many of which stage special exhibits and concert performances for the occasion, before after parties rock on until 0600.
General.Body: This celebration of Amsterdam's cultural bounty turns into a big bash. Pass holders are entitled access to 50 museums from 1800, many of which stage special exhibits and concert performances for the occasion, before after parties rock on until 0600.

General.Teaser: Artists from over 40 countries come together to create their art on the moving canvases of human bodies. The beautiful mountain and lake backdrop adds to this visual feast, which is attended by over 25,000 people. There are a number of different contests - including a night-time competition designed to showcase stunning UV effects - plus workshops, audience participation, music, and a massive fireworks display.
General.Body: Artists from over 40 countries come together to create their art on the moving canvases of human bodies. The beautiful mountain and lake backdrop adds to this visual feast, which is attended by over 25,000 people. There are a number of different contests - including a night-time competition designed to showcase stunning UV effects - plus workshops, audience participation, music, and a massive fireworks display.

General.Teaser: Visitors are able to travel back in time to take a glimpse at what life was like for one of the world's most illustrious composers, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Domgasse 5 is where the composer spent some of his most formative years from1784 to 1787 and it is the only one of Mozart's former residences that still exists today. His former home has been transformed into an informative museum detailing what life was like in Vienna for the great composer.
General.Body: Visitors are able to travel back in time to take a glimpse at what life was like for one of the world's most illustrious composers, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Domgasse 5 is where the composer spent some of his most formative years from1784 to 1787 and it is the only one of Mozart's former residences that still exists today. His former home has been transformed into an informative museum detailing what life was like in Vienna for the great composer. As well as exploring his music, exhibits also detail the everyday aspects of his life, including his relationship with the Freemasons and his passion for games. This is a great exhibition that is open throughout the year.

General.Teaser: Austria's most important international film event, the Viennale is also the oldest and best-known festival in the German-speaking area of the city. Showcasing a great selection of films from all over the world alongside features by home-grown filmmakers, the festival has a particular reputation for screening documentaries and short feature films. First held in 1960, the event has grown to become one of the most significant events of its kind in Vienna and now attracts audiences in excess of 80,000 people each year.
General.Body: Austria's most important international film event, the Viennale is also the oldest and best-known festival in the German-speaking area of the city. Showcasing a great selection of films from all over the world alongside features by home-grown filmmakers, the festival has a particular reputation for screening documentaries and short feature films. First held in 1960, the event has grown to become one of the most significant events of its kind in Vienna and now attracts audiences in excess of 80,000 people each year. It has a great youthful energy and in addition to the screenings there are gala evenings, Q&A sessions with directors and filmmakers, special events and parties.

General.Teaser: Visitors to this magical city can welcome in the New Year in style at a range of open-air events and parties that take place throughout Vienna. Champagne is the preferred tipple at many events and the sound of corks popping is a constant soundtrack to the evening. Numerous tents line the streets and lanes of the old city, hosting parties with live music and DJs where revellers can dance from the afternoon of New Year's Eve through to the small hours of New Year's Day.
General.Body: Visitors to this magical city can welcome in the New Year in style at a range of open-air events and parties that take place throughout Vienna. Champagne is the preferred tipple at many events and the sound of corks popping is a constant soundtrack to the evening. Numerous tents line the streets and lanes of the old city, hosting parties with live music and DJs where revellers can dance from the afternoon of New Year's Eve through to the small hours of New Year's Day.

General.Teaser: Markets selling trinkets, hand-made products, and, of course, glühwein (mulled wine).
General.Body: Markets selling trinkets, hand-made products, and, of course, glühwein (mulled wine).

Event.title: Hour of Commemoration - Mozart's Mother's Birthday

General.Teaser: Mozart's mother's was born on Christmas Day in 1720, and the city of Salzburg celebrates her birthday with a special service and performance at St Aegidius parish church in St Gilgen where she was christened. Visitors can enjoy performances of pieces by Mozart, Haydn and other great composers by a chamber ensemble.
General.Body: Mozart's mother's was born on Christmas Day in 1720, and the city of Salzburg celebrates her birthday with a special service and performance at St Aegidius parish church in St Gilgen where she was christened. Visitors can enjoy performances of pieces by Mozart, Haydn and other great composers by a chamber ensemble.

General.Teaser: As part of the Salzburg Festival's winter programme, revellers can welcome in the New Year in elegant style listening to some of Mozart's most famous works at the spectacular New Year's Concert. It takes place in the Grosses Festspielhaus (Large Festival Hall) in the centre of this magnificent town, the birthplace of the famous composer. After the classical performance, visitors can head out into the square amongst the beautiful baroque buildings to watch the spectacular fireworks display light up the night sky on the stroke of midnight.
General.Body: As part of the Salzburg Festival's winter programme, revellers can welcome in the New Year in elegant style listening to some of Mozart's most famous works at the spectacular New Year's Concert. It takes place in the Grosses Festspielhaus (Large Festival Hall) in the centre of this magnificent town, the birthplace of the famous composer. After the classical performance, visitors can head out into the square amongst the beautiful baroque buildings to watch the spectacular fireworks display light up the night sky on the stroke of midnight. The fun continues on New Year's Day when the streets are filled with musicians and orchestras performing for the crowds.

General.Teaser: Traditional Christmas market dating back to the 15th century.
General.Body: Traditional Christmas market dating back to the 15th century.

General.Teaser: Lyon's Festival of Lights takes place during December when the people of Lyon place little candle lamps in their windows in honour of the Virgin Mary. The origins of the festival date back over 150 years to 1852 when a statue of the Virgin Mary on Fourviere Hill was to be inaugurated. The event had been postponed several times and nearly didn't happen because a ferocious storm broke over the city. But it passed quickly and the people of Lyon spontaneously lit their homes with candles and came out into the streets to celebrate, and the Festival of Lights was born.
General.Body: Lyon's Festival of Lights takes place during December when the people of Lyon place little candle lamps in their windows in honour of the Virgin Mary. The origins of the festival date back over 150 years to 1852 when a statue of the Virgin Mary on Fourviere Hill was to be inaugurated. The event had been postponed several times and nearly didn't happen because a ferocious storm broke over the city. But it passed quickly and the people of Lyon spontaneously lit their homes with candles and came out into the streets to celebrate, and the Festival of Lights was born. The people of Lyon continue this visually spectacular tradition to this day. The modern festival is now a four-day event where contemporary light installations illuminate the city attracting thousands of visitors. As well as a time to celebrate, the festival also acts as a forum for communication with other cities in France and around the world where the issue of light in urban planning and town dwelling is discussed.

General.Teaser: The sunshine and shimmering waters of the Mediterranean are hardly synonymous with Christmas. However, that doesn’t stop the local authorities making an effort to bring a bit of festive spirit to the city with Nice’s Christmas Village. There are a host of attractions including an arts and crafts market, ice rink, Ferris Wheel, and food stalls.
General.Body: The sunshine and shimmering waters of the Mediterranean are hardly synonymous with Christmas. However, that doesn’t stop the local authorities making an effort to bring a bit of festive spirit to the city with Nice’s Christmas Village. There are a host of attractions including an arts and crafts market, ice rink, Ferris Wheel, and food stalls.

General.Teaser: The 42 km (26 miles) course hugs the coast from Nice to Cannes, taking participants on a scenic—albeit exhausting—journey along this beautiful slice of the French Riviera. The course starts at the Promenade des Anglais and ends along Cannes’ most famous street, La Croisette. Little wonder it has been dubbed the ‘five star marathon.’
General.Body: The 42 km (26 miles) course hugs the coast from Nice to Cannes, taking participants on a scenic—albeit exhausting—journey along this beautiful slice of the French Riviera. The course starts at the Promenade des Anglais and ends along Cannes’ most famous street, La Croisette. Little wonder it has been dubbed the ‘five star marathon.’

General.Teaser: Toulouse gives the Anglo-Saxon countries a run for their money with its annual ‘Marché de Noël’. Surrounded by the pink-brick facades of Place du Capitole, the Christmas Market comes complete with an ice rink, spiced wine, dripping fairy lights and homemade crafts. Toulouse then adds its own touch to the proceedings with local cheese and wine.
General.Body: Toulouse gives the Anglo-Saxon countries a run for their money with its annual ‘Marché de Noël’. Surrounded by the pink-brick facades of Place du Capitole, the Christmas Market comes complete with an ice rink, spiced wine, dripping fairy lights and homemade crafts. Toulouse then adds its own touch to the proceedings with local cheese and wine.

General.Teaser: Every year, the Occitan people (the local population of Toulouse) celebrate their ties with the Mediterranean and Oriental worlds. Events span several weeks and include a mix of classical and jazz music, dance and cinema, debate and, of course, food.
General.Body: Every year, the Occitan people (the local population of Toulouse) celebrate their ties with the Mediterranean and Oriental worlds. Events span several weeks and include a mix of classical and jazz music, dance and cinema, debate and, of course, food.

General.Teaser: Every city has a central place to celebrate the coming of the new year. In Paris it’s the Champs-Elysées. Its crowded, drunken and great fun. Fireworks on the Eiffel Tower.
General.Body: Every city has a central place to celebrate the coming of the new year. In Paris it’s the Champs-Elysées. Its crowded, drunken and great fun. Fireworks on the Eiffel Tower.

General.Teaser: National holiday on 11 November with laying of wreaths, military parade and review of troops by the French President of the Republic.
General.Body: National holiday on 11 November with laying of wreaths, military parade and review of troops by the French President of the Republic.

General.Teaser: A vibrant festival of the best European, especially French, contemporary jazz players – with important links to Germany. The key here is diversity: it has around 30 concerts in 10 different locations with plenty of different nationalities, from French to German to American, plus different jazz styles.
General.Body: A vibrant festival of the best European, especially French, contemporary jazz players – with important links to Germany.
