General.Teaser: This festival of classical music first ran in 1999 and since then its popularity has snowballed. Taking place between November and February, it features a series of concerts that celebrate Christmas, New Year and the legacy of Latvian pianist, Herman Braun, who died in 1979.
General.Body: This festival of classical music first ran in 1999 and since then its popularity has snowballed. Taking place between November and February, it features a series of concerts that celebrate Christmas, New Year and the legacy of Latvian pianist, Herman Braun, who died in 1979.
General.VenueName: Various venues (Great Guild Hall, Riga Dome Cathedral)

General.Teaser: As the first Christmas Market to be welcomed into the bosom of Eastern Europe, Budapest’s extensive festive gathering continues to take over Vorosmarty Square towards the end of each year with scores of stalls selling everything from roast meats to mulled wine. With a giant Christmas tree and lit-up walkways, the Hungarian take on the traditional German market also has space for souvenirs and musical performances.
General.Body: As the first Christmas Market to be welcomed into the bosom of Eastern Europe, Budapest’s extensive festive gathering continues to take over Vorosmarty Square towards the end of each year with scores of stalls selling everything from roast meats to mulled wine. With a giant Christmas tree and lit-up walkways, the Hungarian take on the traditional German market also has space for souvenirs and musical performances.

General.Teaser: A great way to see in the New Year, Budapest's New Year's Day Concert welcomes a host of internationally-renowned performers to the stage. The concert takes place in Budapest's stunning 19th-century Opera House, located in the heart of this magical city, with the Budapest Philharmonic Orchestra traditionally wowing the home crowd.
General.Body: A great way to see in the New Year, Budapest's New Year's Day Concert welcomes a host of internationally-renowned performers to the stage. The concert takes place in Budapest's stunning 19th-century Opera House, located in the heart of this magical city, with the Budapest Philharmonic Orchestra traditionally wowing the home crowd.

Event.title: Music-Wine Gala Concert of the 100-Member Gypsy Orchestra

General.Teaser: This lively event provides visitors with an exciting introduction to Hungary's wine regions during an evening of wine-tasting and supper, with music provided by the world-famous 100-Member Gypsy Orchestra. During the concert, visitors are treated to performances of pieces by Khachaturian, Brahms, Strauss, Bizet, Rossini and Liszt as well as classical folk music.
General.Body: This lively event provides visitors with an exciting introduction to Hungary's wine regions during an evening of wine-tasting and supper, with music provided by the world-famous 100-Member Gypsy Orchestra. During the concert, visitors are treated to performances of pieces by Khachaturian, Brahms, Strauss, Bizet, Rossini and Liszt as well as classical folk music.

General.Teaser: Free event attracting large crowds of revellers.
General.Body: Free event attracting large crowds of revellers.
General.VenueName: Various squares and parks in Belgrade.

General.Teaser: Jazz festival featuring performers from Europe and the USA.
General.Body: Jazz festival featuring performers from Europe and the USA.

General.Teaser: A celebration of contemporary dance, this fun and funky festival takes place in December every year. The event has fast become one of Bruges’ cultural highlights and those attending can enjoy a packed programme of performances as well as live music.
General.Body: A celebration of contemporary dance, this fun and funky festival takes place in December every year. The event has fast become one of Bruges’ cultural highlights and those attending can enjoy a packed programme of performances as well as live music.

General.Teaser: Bruges’ fairytale Old Town is a magical place to be during the festivities and the countdown to Christmas begins at the end of November, when seasonal stalls start appearing in the Markt Square. The atmosphere is electric at this Christmas market, which is a great place to pick up presents, souvenirs and festive foods.
General.Body: Bruges’ fairytale Old Town is a magical place to be during the festivities and the countdown to Christmas begins at the end of November, when seasonal stalls start appearing in the Markt Square. The atmosphere is electric at this Christmas market, which is a great place to pick up presents, souvenirs and festive foods.

General.Teaser: The Bruges Beer Festival needs little explanation; you arrive, work through as many beers as possible and stagger home with the dawning realisation that tomorrow will be a write-off. But it’s well worth the hangover because this cracking festival has over 300 Belgium beers on tap and some excellent Flemish cuisine to soak it all up with.
General.Body: The Bruges Beer Festival needs little explanation; you arrive, work through as many beers as possible and stagger home with the dawning realisation that tomorrow will be a write-off. But it’s well worth the hangover because this cracking festival has over 300 Belgium beers on tap and some excellent Flemish cuisine to soak it all up with.

General.DateDescription: Typically, early Dec to early Jan.
General.Teaser: By tradition, Antwerp puts on a big show for most of December – the focus of which is an outdoor ice rink set up on the square in the centre of Old Town. A Christmas Village market is the most popular attraction, with many illuminated stalls selling craftware, gifts, and plenty to eat and drink. Many churches display nativity scenes, and the seasonal good cheer is further boosted by numerous Christmas concerts.
General.Body: By tradition, Antwerp puts on a big show for most of December – the focus of which is an outdoor ice rink set up on the square in the centre of Old Town. A Christmas Village market is the most popular attraction, with many illuminated stalls selling craftware, gifts, and plenty to eat and drink. Many churches display nativity scenes, and the seasonal good cheer is further boosted by numerous Christmas concerts.
General.VenueName: Grote Markt and other squares of Old Antwerp

General.DateDescription: Typically, early Dec to early Jan
General.Teaser: Thanks to Antwerp’s indoor funfair, visitors can enjoy all the fun of the fair without the weather raining on their parade. This traditional fair is a popular family attraction and boasts a carnival atmosphere with a plethora of classic rides that children will surely enjoy.
General.Body: Thanks to Antwerp’s indoor funfair, visitors can enjoy all the fun of the fair without the weather raining on their parade. This traditional fair is a popular family attraction and boasts a carnival atmosphere with a plethora of classic rides that children will surely enjoy.

General.Teaser: Wine and Catholicism come together on Saint Martin's Day, which falls at the end of the wine-growing season. On this day, ritual feasts are held, in which the traditional dish is roast goose. The new season's wine is blessed in ceremonies which are often quite elaborate, taking the form of a 'christening' in which the expected cast of characters - godfather, priest and so forth - is present. Martinje festivities take place in the centre of Zagreb and in the vineyard towns and municipalities of Zagreb County.
General.Body: Wine and Catholicism come together on Saint Martin's Day, which falls at the end of the wine-growing season. On this day, ritual feasts are held, in which the traditional dish is roast goose. The new season's wine is blessed in ceremonies which are often quite elaborate, taking the form of a 'christening' in which the expected cast of characters - godfather, priest and so forth - is present. Martinje festivities take place in the centre of Zagreb and in the vineyard towns and municipalities of Zagreb County.

General.Teaser: Dubrovnik sparkles with fairy-tale romance at the end of the year. Traditional gifts and handicrafts are on sale such as Christmas decorations, candles, toys, glassware, embroidery, ceramics and porcelain. Visitors can tuck into Christmas cookies, mulled wine, candied almonds, and other traditional delicacies including kontonjata (quince cheese), mantala (cheese), prikle (doughnuts) and hrostule (deep fried biscuits).
General.Body: Dubrovnik sparkles with fairy-tale romance at the end of the year. Traditional gifts and handicrafts are on sale such as Christmas decorations, candles, toys, glassware, embroidery, ceramics and porcelain. Visitors can tuck into Christmas cookies, mulled wine, candied almonds, and other traditional delicacies including kontonjata (quince cheese), mantala (cheese), prikle (doughnuts) and hrostule (deep fried biscuits).

General.Teaser: An exciting programme of internationally known artists from the world jazz music scene.
General.Body: An exciting programme of internationally known artists from the world jazz music scene.
General.VenueName: Village Newcastle Hotel, Cobalt Business Park

General.Body: Diverse, exciting arts festival which takes place every two years. The 10-week long programme sees an extraordinary range of artworks, projects and events occur in what is said to be the largest international contemporary art festival in the UK.
General.VenueName: Locations and venues throughout the city.

General.Teaser: The BFI London Film Festival is one of the country’s largest film events. The packed and varied programme shows films from across the world, and screenings take place in many great London film venues, including the South Bank Centre and the Empire and Odeon cinemas in Leicester Square. As well as feature films, there are documentaries, shorts, animations and video installations. The festival also includes galas, talks from famous directors and actors, and movie workshops.
General.Body: The BFI London Film Festival is one of the country’s largest film events. The packed and varied programme shows films from across the world, and screenings take place in many great London film venues, including the South Bank Centre and the Empire and Odeon cinemas in Leicester Square. As well as feature films, there are documentaries, shorts, animations and video installations. The festival also includes galas, talks from famous directors and actors, and movie workshops.
General.VenueName: National Film Theatre and other cinemas around London.

General.Teaser: Every New Year's Eve in London, the city comes alive with celebrations, fireworks and parties in every corner of the capital. The riverside fireworks extravaganza is nothing short of beautiful and draws thousands of people to the Thames. Get there early to bag the best views.
General.Body: Every New Year's Eve in London, the city comes alive with celebrations, fireworks and parties in every corner of the capital. The riverside fireworks extravaganza is nothing short of beautiful and draws thousands of people to the Thames. Get there early to bag the best views.

General.Teaser: Daily European markets selling a variety of unusual Christmas gifts and glühwein (hot mulled wine).
General.Body: Daily European markets selling a variety of unusual Christmas gifts and glühwein (hot mulled wine).

General.Teaser: New Year's Eve celebrations offer the best in Scottish themed entertainment and activities including Highland Dancing, pipe bands, free performances by top Ceilidh bands and much more.
General.Body: New Year's Eve celebrations offer the best in Scottish themed entertainment and activities including Highland Dancing, pipe bands, free performances by top Ceilidh bands and much more.

General.Teaser: Glasgow's annual folk, roots, and world music festival, Celtic Connections celebrates Celtic music and its connections to cultures across the globe. Typically, over 2,000 musicians from around the world descend on Glasgow and bring the city to life for almost three weeks of concerts, ceilidhs, talks, art exhibitions, workshops, and free events.
General.Body: Glasgow's annual folk, roots, and world music festival, Celtic Connections celebrates Celtic music and its connections to cultures across the globe. Typically, over 2,000 musicians from around the world descend on Glasgow and bring the city to life for almost three weeks of concerts, ceilidhs, talks, art exhibitions, workshops, and free events.
General.VenueName: O2 ABC Glasgow, The Mackintosh Church

General.Teaser: The festival programme encompasses a huge range of moving image experiences. Visitors can expect entertaining galas, premieres, parties, lively events, celebrities and of course a collection of stunning documentaries from around the world.
General.Body: The festival programme encompasses a huge range of moving image experiences. Visitors can expect entertaining galas, premieres, parties, lively events, celebrities and of course a collection of stunning documentaries from around the world.

General.Teaser: The Glasgow International Comedy Festival is attracting increasingly bigger and better names, making it one of the most well respected comedy festivals in Britain, rivalling even Edinburgh's line-ups. Venues range from small pubs to big theatres and concert halls, so you can expect everything from major shows featuring big names on the circuit to little gems by unknown performers. Nearly 300 shows take place at some 40 venues all over Glasgow.
General.Body: The Glasgow International Comedy Festival is attracting increasingly bigger and better names, making it one of the most well respected comedy festivals in Britain, rivalling even Edinburgh's line-ups. Venues range from small pubs to big theatres and concert halls, so you can expect everything from major shows featuring big names on the circuit to little gems by unknown performers. Nearly 300 shows take place at some 40 venues all over Glasgow.

General.Teaser: This old-fashioned community festival and street party take place in Glasgow's academic and campus quarter. There is live music, garden fetes, cake stalls, barbecue and family fun days, and a Japanese Matsuri, where visitors put on a kimono, make origami and try their hand at the Japanese alphabet.
General.Body: This old-fashioned community festival and street party take place in Glasgow's academic and campus quarter. There is live music, garden fetes, cake stalls, barbecue and family fun days, and a Japanese Matsuri, where visitors put on a kimono, make origami and try their hand at the Japanese alphabet.
General.VenueName: Various West End venues and streets.

General.Teaser: The Aberdeen International Youth Festival showcases burgeoning talent from around the world and is one of the highlights of the cultural calendar in Aberdeen. The festival opens with a colourful parade through the city centre to the Aberdeen Music Hall for the Opening Ceremony. This is followed by eight days of lively entertainment, including music, theatre and dance, with events taking place throughout Scotland's North East.
General.Body: The Aberdeen International Youth Festival showcases burgeoning talent from around the world and is one of the highlights of the cultural calendar in Aberdeen. The festival opens with a colourful parade through the city centre to the Aberdeen Music Hall for the Opening Ceremony. This is followed by eight days of lively entertainment, including music, theatre and dance, with events taking place throughout Scotland's North East. From orchestral concerts to steel drums, song recitals, massed choirs, traditional music, ballet, African dance and drumming, opera productions, and special events for children - there is something for everyone.

General.Teaser: Offers golfers a chance to test four courses of Grampian's 72 picturesque hole event. Breath-taking scenery and challenging courses allow golf-lovers to experience all the beauty Scotland's greenery has to offer.
General.Body: Offers golfers a chance to test four courses of Grampian's 72 picturesque hole event. Breath-taking scenery and challenging courses allow golf-lovers to experience all the beauty Scotland's greenery has to offer.

General.Teaser: Incorporating elements of its predecessor, Word, May Festival takes place over three days at the historic King's College Campus of the University of Aberdeen and other venues throughout the city. More than 6,000 visitors come to meet around 50 authors in a packed weekend of readings, lectures, debates, music and art exhibitions, and film screenings. Added to this are the Festival of Gaelic and a unique programme for schools and children. Gaelic, Imagination, and Story Tents occupy the King's Lawn, and lectures are given in a state-of-the-art university auditorium.
General.Body: Incorporating elements of its predecessor, Word, May Festival takes place over three days at the historic King's College Campus of the University of Aberdeen and other venues throughout the city. More than 6,000 visitors come to meet around 50 authors in a packed weekend of readings, lectures, debates, music and art exhibitions, and film screenings. Added to this are the Festival of Gaelic and a unique programme for schools and children. Gaelic, Imagination, and Story Tents occupy the King's Lawn, and lectures are given in a state-of-the-art university auditorium.
General.VenueName: King's College Campus, University of Aberdeen

General.Teaser: Come and celebrate contemporary classical, traditional, popular, jazz, and experimental music. The Sound Festival features new music from prominent composers, as well as the exploration of distinctive music in historic venues across Aberdeen. A journey of discovery fit for anyone, the Sound Festival is a sure-fire hit.
General.Body: Come and celebrate contemporary classical, traditional, popular, jazz, and experimental music. The Sound Festival features new music from prominent composers, as well as the exploration of distinctive music in historic venues across Aberdeen. A journey of discovery fit for anyone, the Sound Festival is a sure-fire hit.

General.Teaser: Beef cattle, dairy cattle, heavy native horses and ponies, light-legged horses and ponies, and goats are among a cast of over 5,000 livestock at Scotland's premier agricultural show - one that attracts more than 180,000 visitors over four days. The livestock competitions take place in a vast covered area, but there are many stalls and stands on this extensive site at the edge of Edinburgh. Competitions are numerous and varied, from show jumping to farriery, and from honey, cheese, and butter to sheep shearing.
General.Body: Beef cattle, dairy cattle, heavy native horses and ponies, light-legged horses and ponies, and goats are among a cast of over 5,000 livestock at Scotland's premier agricultural show - one that attracts more than 180,000 visitors over four days. The livestock competitions take place in a vast covered area, but there are many stalls and stands on this extensive site at the edge of Edinburgh. Competitions are numerous and varied, from show jumping to farriery, and from honey, cheese, and butter to sheep shearing. There is a Scottish food exhibition, a giant flower display, and numerous arts and crafts.

General.Teaser: Robert Burns was the poet who used Scottish dialect at a time when this was frowned upon in genteel society. Now he is the much loved National Bard, and Scotsmen everywhere celebrate his life and work on the anniversary of his birth in 1759. Traditionally this takes the form of a Burns' Night supper, an evening meal where Burn's poetry ('To a Haggis', 'Tam O'Shanter' etc) is recited and haggis, neeps (mashed swede), and tatties (mashed potatoes) are consumed.
General.Body: Robert Burns was the poet who used Scottish dialect at a time when this was frowned upon in genteel society. Now he is the much loved National Bard, and Scotsmen everywhere celebrate his life and work on the anniversary of his birth in 1759. Traditionally this takes the form of a Burns' Night supper, an evening meal where Burn's poetry ('To a Haggis', 'Tam O'Shanter' etc) is recited and haggis, neeps (mashed swede), and tatties (mashed potatoes) are consumed.

General.Teaser: Scotland celebrates the New Year like nowhere else and Edinburgh's own Hogmanay is billed as the biggest and best in the world. Over three days there is a relentless succession of fun events, including a torchlit procession, concert in the Gardens with top groups, outdoor ceilidh (The Keilidh), and street party. And of course, there's a spectacular Seven Hills firework display on the stroke of midnight, 31 December on the heights of Edinburgh Castle and six other prominent positions across the city.
General.Body: Scotland celebrates the New Year like nowhere else and Edinburgh's own Hogmanay is billed as the biggest and best in the world. Over three days there is a relentless succession of fun events, including a torchlit procession, concert in the Gardens with top groups, outdoor ceilidh (The Keilidh), and street party. And of course, there's a spectacular Seven Hills firework display on the stroke of midnight, 31 December on the heights of Edinburgh Castle and six other prominent positions across the city.
General.VenueName: Various streets and venues in Edinburgh

General.Teaser: For a quarter of a century, brave swimmers have been bringing in the New Year with a bracing dip in the Forth. Participants join a grand parade along South Queensferry's High Street before plunging into chilly water beneath the historic Forth Bridge. The event raises enormous sums for charity, attracts large crowds of amused onlookers, and is now officially part of Edinburgh's Hogmanay celebrations. Register in advance from late September.
General.Body: For a quarter of a century, brave swimmers have been bringing in the New Year with a bracing dip in the Forth. Participants join a grand parade along South Queensferry's High Street before plunging into chilly water beneath the historic Forth Bridge. The event raises enormous sums for charity, attracts large crowds of amused onlookers, and is now officially part of Edinburgh's Hogmanay celebrations. Register in advance from late September.

General.Teaser: Known as the toughest off-road run in the UK, 'Rat Race-The Mighty Deerstalker' requires participants to plough through mud filled trenches, scramble up scree slopes, and navigate the night - usually dressed in kilts, tweed, or other "appropriate" athletic apparel. After crossing the finish line, runners can stumble over to the legendary Beerstalker party tent and limber up for a bit of crowd surfing.
General.Body: Known as the toughest off-road run in the UK, 'Rat Race-The Mighty Deerstalker' requires participants to plough through mud filled trenches, scramble up scree slopes, and navigate the night - usually dressed in kilts, tweed, or other "appropriate" athletic apparel. After crossing the finish line, runners can stumble over to the legendary Beerstalker party tent and limber up for a bit of crowd surfing.

Poya holidays take place in Sri Lanka every full moon, but the most important of them is Vesak Poya in May. It's a chance for Buddhists to celebrate the Buddha's birth, enlightenment and death with prayer, mediation and partying. Streamers traditionally hang from buses and free food is handed out at street stalls across the country.

General.EventCost: $16 for adults; $12 for children during the week; $20 for adults and $16 for children on Saturdays.
General.Teaser: Historic Hudson River Valley is a spooky place come Halloween; after all, this was the home of Washington Irving, author of the famed "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow." During October, the town of Croton-on-Hudson hosts a weeks-long Halloween celebration featuring more than 4,000 jack-o-lanterns hand-carved by more than 1,000 volunteers.
General.Body: Historic Hudson River Valley is a spooky place come Halloween; after all, this was the home of Washington Irving, author of the famed "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow." During October, the town of Croton-on-Hudson hosts a weeks-long Halloween celebration featuring more than 4,000 jack-o-lanterns hand-carved by more than 1,000 volunteers.

Moving between the northern city of Jaffna and Galle in the south on alternating years, this eclectic music festival showcases everything from classical pieces to folk and fusion music. Workshops following themes such as sound engineering and arts and crafts take place alongside the main live events.

Colombo's most famous festival draws thousands of visitors and locals for a two-day display of pomp and circumstance. Featuring parading elephants, dancers, street performers, musicians and torchlight processions, it's one of the most colourful events in the country's calendar. Hotels are often fully booked over the festival, so be sure to arrange accommodation in advance.

General.Teaser: Despite being mainly a family affair, there are a few events taking place in Bogotá in December to celebrate Christmas. Over 60 artisans make up theferia artesanal navideña, which allows them to sell their wares in Candelaria (el Parque de Los Talentos). Many concerts are also held in churches during this period too.
General.Body: Despite being mainly a family affair, there are a few events taking place in Bogotá in December to celebrate Christmas. Over 60 artisans make up theferia artesanal navideña, which allows them to sell their wares in Candelaria (el Parque de Los Talentos). Many concerts are also held in churches during this period too.

General.Teaser: A 24-hour, non-stop celebration of city culture that showcases everything from dance and film to art and theatre. Organisers lean heavily on the musical side of things as well with over 2,000 artists performing across the whole day and night. Taking its cue from the inversion of expectations, the event will have museums opening from dawn and plenty of the unexpected in the downtown area of São Paulo.
General.Body: A 24-hour, non-stop celebration of city culture that showcases everything from dance and film to art and theatre. Organisers lean heavily on the musical side of things as well with over 2,000 artists performing across the whole day and night. Taking its cue from the inversion of expectations, the event will have museums opening from dawn and plenty of the unexpected in the downtown area of São Paulo.

Event.title: Mostra Internacional de Cinema (São Paulo International Film Festival)

General.Teaser: Stock up on popcorn because silver screen fever grips during this two-week celluloid fest. Premieres, retrospectives, foreign-language films, blockbusters and outdoors screenings, complete a dazzling cast at the annual Mostra Internacional de Cinema, which will show around 350 titles in 20 different venues.
General.Body: Stock up on popcorn because silver screen fever grips during this two-week celluloid fest. Premieres, retrospectives, foreign-language films, blockbusters and outdoors screenings, complete a dazzling cast at the annual Mostra Internacional de Cinema, which will show around 350 titles in 20 different venues.

General.Teaser: With street credit from the stellar success of supermodels like Giselle Bündchen, São Paulo Fashion Week is now regarded as the fifth fashion week after New York, Paris, Milan and London. Lashings of haute couture and exotic models tread catwalks during this biannual jolly. Exciting new Brazilian designers air their frocks twice yearly with separate fashion weeks in January (fall and winter styles) and June (spring and summer styles).
General.Body: With street credit from the stellar success of supermodels like Giselle Bündchen, São Paulo Fashion Week is now regarded as the fifth fashion week after New York, Paris, Milan and London. Lashings of haute couture and exotic models tread catwalks during this biannual jolly. Exciting new Brazilian designers air their frocks twice yearly with separate fashion weeks in January (fall and winter styles) and June (spring and summer styles).

General.Teaser: Prepare for high octane thrills and spills as the Formula 1 circus wends its way to São Paulo for the annual grand prix. Two days of qualifying kicks off the weekend before the main event at the famed Interlagos racetrack, a course renowned for being one of the most difficult to master on the F1 circuit.
General.Body: Prepare for high octane thrills and spills as the Formula 1 circus wends its way to São Paulo for the annual grand prix. Two days of qualifying kicks off the weekend before the main event at the famed Interlagos racetrack, a course renowned for being one of the most difficult to master on the F1 circuit.

General.Teaser: Okay, while it’s not exactly Rio, São Paulo’s celebrations beginning on the Friday before Ash Wednesday are a riot of samba school rehearsals, street parades and blocos (individually planned street parties). The Sambódromo, however, is the crème de la crème as it comes to life with samba schools battling for supremacy.
General.Body: Okay, while it’s not exactly Rio, São Paulo’s celebrations beginning on the Friday before Ash Wednesday are a riot of samba school rehearsals, street parades and blocos (individually planned street parties). The Sambódromo, however, is the crème de la crème as it comes to life with samba schools battling for supremacy.

General.DateDescription: Every two years in September and December.
General.Teaser: Inspired by the Venice Biennale art festival, the São Paulo Art Biennial takes place every two years between September and December. Running since the early 1950s, the event allows Brazilian and international artists to display their works in the Oscar Niemeyer building in the Parque Ibirapuera.
General.Body: Inspired by the Venice Biennale art festival, the São Paulo Art Biennial takes place every two years between September and December. Running since the early 1950s, the event allows Brazilian and international artists to display their works in the Oscar Niemeyer building in the Parque Ibirapuera.

General.Teaser: The annual Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT) parade is the world’s largest, attracting around four million people. Expect riotously colourful processions of floats and street dancing in a parade that stretches for 4.2km (2.6 miles), right through Avenida Paulista.
General.Body: The annual Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT) parade is the world’s largest, attracting around four million people. Expect riotously colourful processions of floats and street dancing in a parade that stretches for 4.2km (2.6 miles), right through Avenida Paulista.

General.Teaser: Outdoor concerts and parties all over the city culminate in a massive fireworks display on Copacabana Beach to mark Rio’s New Year’s Eve celebrations, its second biggest bash after Carnival. Up to one million people gather on the sands, so get there early to stake your place.
General.Body: Outdoor concerts and parties all over the city culminate in a massive fireworks display on Copacabana Beach to mark Rio’s New Year’s Eve celebrations, its second biggest bash after Carnival. Up to one million people gather on the sands, so get there early to stake your place.

General.EventCost: The parade is free, but separate events may by ticketed.
General.Teaser: The Rio de Janeiro Pride (Parada de Orgulho Gay) is one of the biggest gay pride parades in the world. More than two million people take part in parties, on the Zona Sul beaches and across the city, in celebration of sexual diversity and equality. Visitors will be hard pressed not to find a samba band or sounds system somewhere around the capital.
General.Body: The Rio de Janeiro Pride (Parada de Orgulho Gay) is one of the biggest gay pride parades in the world. More than two million people take part in parties, on the Zona Sul beaches and across the city, in celebration of sexual diversity and equality. Visitors will be hard pressed not to find a samba band or sounds system somewhere around the capital.

General.Teaser: The 'Festival do Rio' is the city's International Film Festival. In recent years Brazilian films based in Rio, such as Central Station, City of God, and Favela Rising have received worldwide acclaim. This major festival showcases well over 500 feature films, documentaries and shorts, with screenings taking place in various venues throughout the city. Proceedings are dominated by the award of the coveted Golden Lion prize. In addition to the films, there's also an entertainment programme including live music and parties.
General.Body: The 'Festival do Rio' is the city's International Film Festival. In recent years Brazilian films based in Rio, such as Central Station, City of God, and Favela Rising have received worldwide acclaim. This major festival showcases well over 500 feature films, documentaries and shorts, with screenings taking place in various venues throughout the city. Proceedings are dominated by the award of the coveted Golden Lion prize. In addition to the films, there's also an entertainment programme including live music and parties.

General.Teaser: Visitors to this, the most revered international polo tournament at club level, can enjoy many a great polo game, as well as scores of high-end socialising and first-rate people watching. Expect to see some of the very best players in the game today, as teams from all over the polo-playing world compete in Buenos Aires. The popular polo championship has taken place in Palermo since 1893, and is a major social event as well as a sporting highlight on the Argentine calendar.
General.Body: Visitors to this, the most revered international polo tournament at club level, can enjoy many a great polo game, as well as scores of high-end socialising and first-rate people watching. Expect to see some of the very best players in the game today, as teams from all over the polo-playing world compete in Buenos Aires. The popular polo championship has taken place in Palermo since 1893, and is a major social event as well as a sporting highlight on the Argentine calendar.
General.VenueName: Campo Argentino de Polo de Palermo.

Address.Address2: Corner Avenida Libertador and Avenida Dorrego in barrio (district) of Palermo, on northeast side of city

General.Teaser: The annual gay pride parade in Buenos Aires is as vibrant and exuberant as you might expect. This dazzling outdoor celebration takes over the city’s central streets in November, with flamboyant processions, and much dancing and music.
General.Body: The annual gay pride parade in Buenos Aires is as vibrant and exuberant as you might expect. This dazzling outdoor celebration takes over the city’s central streets in November, with flamboyant processions, and much dancing and music.
General.VenueName: Plaza Mayo and city centre streets.

General.Teaser: The gaucho town of San Antonio de Areco, an hour or so from Buenos Aires, is the place to be on 10 November to celebrate Argentina’s Día de la Tradición. The small, charming town comes alive with a full-on gaucho festival featuring horse parades, music and, of course, lots and lots of meat.
General.Body: The gaucho town of San Antonio de Areco, an hour or so from Buenos Aires, is the place to be on 10 November to celebrate Argentina’s Día de la Tradición. The small, charming town comes alive with a full-on gaucho festival featuring horse parades, music and, of course, lots and lots of meat.

Sri Lanka's burgeoning ballooning scene is celebrated in this week-long flying festival, which sees a colourful crop of balloons float over the towns of Sigiriya and Hambantota as well as the city of Colombo. It's the perfect opportunity to enjoy an extended aerial tour of Sri Lanka.

Starting on poya day in December and running until the Vesak festival in May, the pilgrimage season sees thousands of visitors make the long trek up Adam's Peak (Sri Pada) - Sri Lanka's highest point and one of the most sacred places on the island. A string of twinkling lights guides pilgrims during the taxing slog up from the settlement of Dalhousie to the summit.

One of the biggest and best-loved events of its kind in the country, the International Ballet Festival of Havana attracts some of the top dancers from around the world who perform along with artists from the country's own National Ballet of Cuba. The first International Ballet Festival of Havana was held in 1960 and became a biennial event from 1974. To this day, the event continues to be the most prestigious ballet festival in Cuba and one of the most anticipated globally.
